results.title: Ponies
results.creator_credit: Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Hector Lemieux
results.brief_description: Natural sounds and music combine with the beauty of colour and motion to present the pageantry of the pony world. On hilltops, in streams, in wood and meadow, Welsh ponies are seen and heard in a kaleidoscope of mood and motion. A foal is born. A pony is schooled for the show ring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Hector Lemieux

results.title: Pong
results.brief_description: Pong, the 2007 single from German cyber-goth band Eisenfunk, extensively uses samples from the game Pong, as well as featuring a stylised version of it in the video clip.

constellations_other.name: The first home console and the art of ping pong
constellations_other.description: An exploration of tennis and ping pong throughout the moving image.

results.description: ‘Pong’, the 2007 single from German cyber-goth band Eisenfunk, extensively uses samples from the game Pong, as well as featuring a stylised version of it in the video clip.

results.title: Ponds: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Seabourne Enterprises, Anvil Films and Record Group and Donald Walton
results.brief_description: Explains the yearly cycle of pond life, the dependence on warmth and light for growth and the interchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide. The pond returns to rest period when days shorten and the water becomes cold and minerals are replenished from decaying plants and animals in readiness for the circle to begin again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Seabourne Enterprises, Anvil Films and Record Group and Donald Walton

results.creator_credit: Warren Thomas, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Looks at activities related to ponding and examines the resources and simple apparatus available from the Gould League to support such activities. Presented by Trevor Lunn.

results.title: Pond insects
results.brief_description: The diving water beetle, the mayfly, and the dragonfly represent this group of insects. Their life cycles are portrayed as well as their food habits and struggle for existence.

results.title: Pond (Episode 2)
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Examines the interdependent embers of a pond community. Observes life forms above and blow the surface of the water. From he Ecology series, No 2.

results.title: Pompeii and Vesuvius
results.brief_description: Shows an actual eruption of Mt Vesuvius and against this background recalls the destruction of the city of Pompeii in 79 AD. The film depicts present-day life in the ruined city of Pompeii and life in the cities and villages around Naples, including folk dancing in Sorrento.

results.title: Polyurethane progress
results.brief_description: A technical film dealing with research, manufacturing processes and the development of outlets for the rigid and flexible foam plastic industry. Illustrates the advanced scientific methods of production, including the moulding of foam car seats by micro-wave units, and the application of rigid foam to wall and other surfaces for insulation purposes.

results.title: Polychrome phantasy
results.brief_description: In this early film Norman McLaren shot crystal formations through a low-power microscope, using polarized light with the lower part of the picture masked off. The film was then rewound and a scene of dancers was filmed. No dialogue or music.
results.description: In this early film Norman McLaren shot crystal formations through a low-power microscope, using polarized light with the lower part of the picture masked off. The film was then rewound and a scene of dancers was filmed. No dialogue or music.

results.title: Polska
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, AFFC and David Bradbury
results.brief_description: A documentary on contemporary life in and history of Poland. Shows Lech Walensa speaking in public, and has interviews with Poles about daily life in Poland. Recorded in English but contains subtitles in English for spoken Polish. Filmed in colour with some Black & White sequences.
results.description: A documentary on contemporary life in and history of Poland. Shows Lech Walensa speaking in public, and has interviews with Poles about daily life in Poland. Recorded in English but contains subtitles in English for spoken Polish. Filmed in colour with some Black & White sequences.
